meanings.definition: A small North American diving duck with a large head and a white patch on the back of its head.
meanings.sent1: The buffleheads gracefully dove into the water to catch fish.
meanings.sent2: I saw a flock of buffleheads swimming in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The buffleheads decided to have a diving competition for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a flock of buffleheads, diving into the depths of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The buffleheads' distinctive white patch made them easy to spot in the pond.

meanings.sent1: We observed a beautiful formation of buffleheads flying in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The buffleheads gathered near the shore, chattering happily.
meanings.sent3: The buffleheads held a meeting to discuss their next migration.
meanings.sent4: The buffleheads moved in unison, like a synchronized dance in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the buffleheads in flight was a mesmerizing display of unity.
